sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is distributive over intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the symmetric difference of set A and set B. Then, find the intersection of set A and set B. Finally, use the distributive property to show that the symmetric difference of set A and set B is distributive over the intersection of set A and set B.
